security_audit.summary: This is a pure markdown documentation skill containing only guidance for creating pull requests using git and GitHub CLI. All 64 static findings are false positives: the scanner misidentified YAML frontmatter as cryptographic code, markdown code fences as shell execution, and documentation links as suspicious URLs. No executable code, scripts, or dangerous capabilities are present.

content.user_title: Create pull requests with Sentry conventions
content.value_statement: This skill guides you through creating GitHub pull requests following Sentry engineering practices. It provides step-by-step instructions for branch verification, change analysis, and PR description writing. The skill ensures consistent PR formatting and helps teams maintain code review standards.
actual_capabilities: Verifies branch state and remote status before PR creation
Analyzes commits and changes to understand PR scope
Writes structured PR descriptions following Sentry conventions
Creates pull requests using GitHub CLI (gh)
Formats PR titles using conventional commit format
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be pre-installed and authenticated
Does not create branches or commit changes (use commit skill separately)
Cannot modify existing PRs after creation
Designed for GitHub only, not GitLab or Bitbucket

use_cases.title: Submit changes to repositories
use_cases.description: Create well-formatted pull requests following project conventions for faster review acceptance and clearer communication.

use_cases.title: Maintain consistent PR standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members follow the same PR structure and description format across the organization.

use_cases.title: Improve review efficiency
use_cases.description: Generate PRs with clear descriptions that explain the why behind changes and reduce review back-and-forth.

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the create-pr skill to create a pull request for my current branch

prompt_templates.title: Add reviewers
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR and add @username1 and @username2 as reviewers

prompt_templates.title: Document new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR for my feature branch with a description explaining the new functionality and motivation

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix with issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR for a bug fix that references issue SENTRY-1234 and explains the root cause

output_examples.input: Create a PR for my current changes
output: Verified branch is up to date with main
Created PR: feat(auth): Add OAuth2 login support
Tip: Add reviewers with: gh pr edit --add-reviewer username

output_examples.input: Create a PR with reviewers for my bug fix
output: Verified branch is rebased on main
Analyzed 1 commit fixing the null response issue
Created PR: fix(api): Handle null response in user endpoint

best_practices: Run the commit skill first to ensure all changes are committed before creating a PR
Keep PRs small and focused on a single feature or fix for faster reviews
Explain the why behind changes in the description, not just the what
anti_patterns: Bundling unrelated changes in a single PR
Leaving PR descriptions empty or with just a title
Skipping the branch verification step and creating PRs with uncommitted changes

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: GitHub CLI (gh) must be installed and authenticated. Run gh auth login first.

faq.question: Does this skill create branches?
faq.answer: No, this skill only creates pull requests. Use the commit skill to commit changes first.

faq.question: Can I use this with GitLab or Bitbucket?
faq.answer: No, this skill is designed for GitHub only using the gh CLI tool.

faq.question: Is my data safe when creating PRs?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only reads git status and creates PRs via authenticated gh CLI.

faq.question: What if my branch is behind main?
faq.answer: Rebase your branch on main first. The skill checks for this during verification.

faq.question: How is this different from gh pr create directly?
faq.answer: This skill adds Sentry conventions, structured descriptions, and reviewer guidance.
